item.title: First Look at Sophie Turner as Lara Croft in Prime Video‚Äôs Tomb Raider
item.content:encoded:
The Daily Mail has shared new looks at Sophie Turner in the role of Lara Croft in the upcoming Tomb Raider series for Prime Video.

On February 6, 2026, the Daily Mail shared photos of Lara Croft in action, showing Sophie Turner parachuting over a lake and running through the woods. Instead of Croft‚Äôs signature green top and shorts, she wore athletic wear and cargo pants for the scene, which was filmed in the rain in Surrey.

As of yet, there‚Äôs no release date for the upcoming series, which will also feature Sigourney Weaver and Jason Isaacs, and began filming in January. However, Sophie has already encountered some challenges while filming the role. She stated on the Julia Cunningham Show that she‚Äôd become aware of back issues during Tomb Raider training.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve learned I have a perpetual back problem, but I also realised that it‚Äôs much easier to kind of build muscle if you‚Äôve ever worked out before in your life, which I never had,‚Äù she said.

Prime Video Is Becoming a Home for Video Game-to-TV Adaptations

In addition to the forthcoming Tomb Raider series, Prime Video is also home to the popular Fallout adaptation, which just wrapped up its second season. They are also developing a God of War TV series in which Ryan Hurst will play Kratos.

Fans can learn more about that series here.

There is no release date yet for the upcoming Tomb Raider show. Insider Gaming will continue to monitor the story and report any updates.

Are you excited for the upcoming series? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: MANGMI launches new Pocket Max Android Gaming Handheld
item.content:encoded:
MANGMI has launched its new Pocket Max, a new android-powered gaming handheld.

Available now for $199.99 (until February 12) the MANGMI Pocket Max features a Snapdragon 865 processor with Adreno 650 graphics. According to MANGMI, the Pocket Max ‚Äúdelivers a smooth cloud and game streaming experience, streaming AAA titles directly from your PC, PlayStation, or Xbox.‚Äù

The handheld is also ‚Äúthe first Android handheld with magnetic modules‚Äù this lets players ‚Äúswap freely between conductive rubber and mechanical micro-switch D-pads and ABXY buttons.‚Äù

The device features a 7-inch, 1920√ó1080 AMOLED display with a 144Hz refresh rate and HDR support. Storage wise, it comes with 128GB internal storage and a MicroSD slot for additional space.

Other features include an 8000mAh battery, 6axis G-Sensor, Hall Triggers, and RGB TMR Sticks. You can check out the full specs list below, courtesy of MANGMI

After the ‚Äúsuper early bird‚Äù price ends on February 12, the Pocket Max will retail for an ‚Äúearly bird‚Äù price of $219.99. After that, it‚Äôll jump to $239.99.

What do you think of the MANGMI Pocket Max? Leave your thoughts below, and join the discussion in the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more tech news, read about Western Digital wanting to release a 100TB hard drive by 2029. And for even more Insider Gaming delivered directly to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Mike has been covering the gaming industry since 2012, and has reported on some of the largest events in the industry while also working as an investigative reporter. Outside of‚Ä¶

item.title: When Is Honkai: Star Rail Collab Coming To Fortnite? Release Date, Skins & Free ‚ÄòBlade‚Äô Outfit
item.content:encoded:
Fortnite loves a good collab. miHoYo and Honkai: Star Rail are joining forces with the Fortnite goliath to create epic content for all players to experience through skins and more, and a release date is available.

Honkai: Star Rail is another HoYoverse success, with the free-to-play title continuing to dominate the scene over two years after its explosion into the universe. Epic Games smells success from a mile away, which is why a Honkai: Star Rail and Fortnite collab makes too much sense NOT to do.

Honkai: Star Rail & Fortnite Collab Release Date

The Fortnite and Honkai: Star Rail collab goes live on February 26.

This isn‚Äôt a collab weeks away or months down the pipeline; the official announcement was revealed on February 6. In the same statement, ‚ÄòFebruary 26‚Äô was outed, and arrives one week after the now-delayed Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 2.

  • More Insider Gaming: Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 1 Human Bill Boss Location‚ÄîWhere to Find & All Loot

It‚Äôs not an extensive crossover, but fans of both franchises will be pleased with the upcoming content.

You can look forward to ‚ÄúA brand-new UEFN island and kick off a creator-involved collaboration tournament,‚Äù to celebrate the occasion.

All Honkai: Star Rail & Fortnite Content & Skins

Kafka and Blade are the headline additions in the Honkai: Star Rail and Fortnite collab, debuting with cool character outfits, and there will also be the usual array of content: Back Bling, Pickaxe, and more.

Here‚Äôs everything that‚Äôs been revealed so far, along with the expected content arriving:

  • Stellaron Hunter Kafka skin (compatible with LEGO styles).
  • Stellaron Hunter Blade skin (compatible with LEGO styles).
  • Back Bling.
  • Pick Axe.
  • Additional crossover content.
  • Emote (Unconfirmed).
  • Glider (Unconfirmed).

Here‚Äôs what‚Äôs been said about the crossover so far:

‚ÄúThe collaboration introduces Outfits (compatible with LEGO styles) for Kafka and Blade into the Fortnite Shop, each featuring a distinctive visual design drawn from their in-game identities in Honkai: Star Rail. Players will also be able to obtain a Back Bling, a Pickaxe, and access additional crossover content, including LEGO Styles for use in LEGO Fortnite.‚Äù

How To Get Free Blade Character Outfit In Fortnite

You need to download Honkai: Star Rail from the Epic Games Store during the outlined Fortnite collab period, and ‚Äúparticipate in designated activities‚Äù to receive a free ‚ÄúBlade‚Äù character outfit.

  • More Insider Gaming: Fortnite February 2026 Roadmap: Love Legends Event, Collabs & More

The activities have yet to be defined, so you‚Äôll have to hang fire until the collab is out first. The skin itself and the design are also unconfirmed, but if you love Honkai: Star Rail, it will be a must-complete challenge(s).

Are you looking forward to a Honkai and Fortnite collab? What collabs do you hope to see in 2026? Share your suggestions through the Insider Gaming Discord Server.

Check out where to find a lock-on Assault Rifle in Fortnite and where to find Bigfoot for more guides and content.

item.title: Amazon Prime Free Games For February 2026 Includes Tiny Tina‚Äôs Wonderlands
item.content:encoded:
Amazon has announced its latest collection of free games available for all Amazon Prime members in February.

Available on Amazon Luna, formerly known as Prime Gaming, this month includes 10 games over the course of four weeks to claim. This month‚Äôs games include titles like Tiny Tina‚Äôs Wonderlands, Ambition: A Minuet in Power, and Total War: Attila.

To claim the games, simply visit the Amazon Luna site and login.

After you claim the games, you‚Äôll be given a code for various storefronts. All you have to do is redeem them in the proper store, and the games are yours to keep forever. It‚Äôs important to note that the games are for PC only.

That‚Äôs even if you decide to cancel your Amazon Prime Membership.

Below you can find the full list of games you can claim this month from Amazon along with when they‚Äôll be available and the stores the codes are for. Be sure to leave your thoughts on the available games in the comments and over in the official Insider Gaming Discord.

Amazon Prime‚Äôs Free Games ‚Äì February 2026

Available Today

  • Tiny Tina‚Äôs Wonderlands ‚Äì Epic Games Story
  • Dread Templayer ‚Äì Amazon Games App

February 12

  • Hexguardian ‚Äì Epic Games Store
  • Around the World: Travel to Brazil Collector‚Äôs Edition ‚Äì Legacy Games

February 19

  • Ambition: A Minuet in Power ‚Äì GOG
  • Captain Blood ‚Äì GOG
  • Meganoid ‚Äì GOG

February 26

  • Rebel Galaxy Outlaw ‚Äì GOG
  • Total War: Attila ‚Äì Epic Games Store
  • Tavern Talk ‚Äì Amazon Games App

Should none of these games tickle your fancy, there are plenty of other games you can claim right now on the service. Some of the games include Civilization 6, Gunslugs: Rogue Tactics, Elderborn, Lego 2K Drive, and Harold Halibut, among others.

There are also hundreds of other games you can play directly in your browser through the Amazon Luna streaming service. Amazon Luna is included with your Amazon Prime membership.

For more news, read about Nvidia reportedly not planning to release new graphics cards in 2026. And for even more Insider Gaming delivered directly to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter.
